title: ARK -- A Social and Political Archive for Northern Ireland
abstractText: The goal of ARK - the Northern Ireland Social and Political Archive - is to make material on social and political life in Northern Ireland accessible to the widest possible audience. The target users of ARK are academics, journalists, policymakers, schoolchildren, voluntary groups, and anyone with an interest in current social issues in Northern Ireland located either within the province or further afield. The activities of ARK include: the CAIN (Conflict Archive on the Internet) website – the definitive source of information on the Northern Irish conflict; the annual Northern Ireland Life & Times Survey of social attitudes; the Young Life & Times survey of 16 year-olds; ORB, an online research database of social policy research; the ARK Seminar Series and Research Updates on social issues of public concern; an expanding archive of qualitative research on Northern Ireland; and the ARK Research Centre, which assists community groups and other bodies in the public arena carry out research on issues vital to them. The ESRC is providing core funding for ARK’s infrastructure activities over a period of five years and, apart from its commercial research support services, all of the ARK resources are available free of charge. Further details on all of ARK's work is available at: www.ark.ac.uk
